question: [File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_decimals() + from_decimals()] [Precision Preservation] Can repeated conversions between raw and decimal representation lose precision, breaking vault accounting over time? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_oracle_price_decimals() + from_oracle_price_decimals()] [Conversion Loss] Do these conversions preserve price precision, or can important price information be lost in decimal conversions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Constants: DECIMALS] [Precision Choice] Is 1e9 (DECIMALS) sufficient precision for all vault calculations, or can operations involving billions of tokens lose precision in share accounting? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Constants: ORACLE_DECIMALS] [Precision Choice] Is 1e18 (ORACLE_DECIMALS) consistent with Switchboard oracle output format, or can decimal mismatch cause 1000x valuation errors? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Constants: DECIMALS vs ORACLE_DECIMALS] [Conversion Errors] Can confusion between 1e9 and 1e18 decimals in caller code cause catastrophic valuation errors when using these utility functions incorrectly? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Adaptor Integration] Can Navi, Suilend, Cetus, or Momentum adaptors generate conflicting keys if they use similar type names or overlapping idx ranges? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Share Calculation] When used in vault share minting, can rounding down in mul_d() cause share supply to be systematically undervalued, benefiting late depositors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Share Redemption] When used in vault share burning, can rounding down in div_d() cause users to receive fewer assets than their shares are worth? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Total Value Calculation] If this function is used in total_usd_value calculation without proper overflow checks, can large portfolios cause DoS? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Asset Allocation] If used to determine asset allocation amounts, can zero prices or overflow cause vault to allocate zero or fail operations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [State Migration] If used in vault migration or snapshot operations, can large state cause excessive gas costs or transaction size limits? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Type Parameter] Can generic type T be any type without constraints, allowing non-store types to be used incorrectly in asset key generation? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Type Constraints] Are copy + drop + store constraints sufficient, or can types with custom drop logic cause issues during cloning? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Edge Case: Both Zeros] When both v1 and v2 are zero, does mul_d() return zero correctly, and is this safe in all vault contexts? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Edge Case: One Max] When v1 is u256::MAX and v2 is 1, does mul_d() overflow before division even though result should fit? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Edge Case: Equal Values] When v1 equals v2, does div_d() return exactly DECIMALS (1e9) or can rounding cause slight deviation? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Edge Case: v1 Zero] When v1 is zero, does div_d() correctly return zero regardless of v2 value (assuming v2 non-zero)? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Edge Case: v2 is ORACLE_DECIMALS] When oracle price equals exactly 1e18 (price = $1), does result equal v1 correctly? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Edge Case: Equal to ORACLE_DECIMALS] When v1 equals v2, does result equal ORACLE_DECIMALS, or can rounding affect this? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Invariant: Non-Zero Input, Non-Zero Output] Can mul_d() return zero when both inputs are non-zero due to precision loss, breaking vault invariants? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Invariant: Larger Input, Larger Output] If v1a > v1b, is div_d(v1a, v2) always > div_d(v1b, v2), or can rounding break monotonicity? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Invariant: Positive Balance, Positive Value] Can positive asset balance and positive price ever result in zero USD value due to rounding? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Invariant: Positive Value, Positive Balance] Can positive USD value and positive price ever result in zero asset balance due to rounding? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Attack: Rounding Accumulation] Can attacker repeatedly execute operations that round down in mul_d() to systematically drain vault value? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Attack: Rounding Exploitation] Can attacker structure withdrawals to exploit rounding in div_d() to receive more assets than deserved? (High)
